properties.areaDesc: Foggy Bottom; San Joaquin Confluence; Merced and Madera
properties.headline: Dense Fog Advisory issued January 25 at 4:57AM PST until January 25 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Hanford CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...Visibility less than one quarter mile in dense fog.
Visibility will be 500 feet or less in some locations.

* WHERE...Merced County, the San Joaquin Valley in Madera County,
and the San Joaquin Valley from Kerman to Corcoran west of
Highway 99 and east of a line from Tranquility to Lemoore Naval
Air Station.

* WHEN...Until noon PST today.

* IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility.
Travel delays.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Roads impacted include highway 99 north of
Fresno County...Highway 152 east of Los Banos...Highway 43 from
Selma to Corcoran...Highway 198 between Goshen and Lemoore and
Highway 41 from Stratford to Easton.
properties.instruction:
When fog is dense, drive with common sense! Slow down, use only
low beam headlights and keep safe braking distance between your
vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. Allow extra time to reach
your destination.

NWSheadline: DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST TODAY
